meanings.definition: To restrict a variable to discrete values rather than a continuous range.
meanings.sent1: I can quantise the number of candies I eat each day to only three.
meanings.sent2: The teacher decided to quantise the acceptable answers to only yes or no.
meanings.sent3: I tried to quantise the amount of time I spend on my phone, but it's hard!
meanings.sent4: She managed to quantise her emotions into happy or sad categories.
meanings.sent5: He tried to quantise his thoughts into simple ideas, but it was challenging.

meanings.definition: To measure or express the quantity of something in discrete units.
meanings.sent1: Let's quantise the amount of sugar needed for the recipe to one cup.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often quantise data to make it easier to analyze.
meanings.sent3: I decided to quantise my savings into jars labeled for different expenses.
meanings.sent4: She tried to quantise her love for him, but it was immeasurable.
meanings.sent5: The artist tried to quantise the colors in the painting, but it lacked depth.
